questions.question: What does each row of a transition matrix represent in a 3-state HMM (Bear, Sideways, Bull)?
options: Probabilities of moving from that row's state to each column's state next step
Historical average returns of each state
questions.explanation: Row i lists P(state_t+1 = j | state_t = i) over all j; row sums to 1.

questions.question: Given a simplified 2-state chain with P(S→S)=0.8, P(S→B)=0.2, P(B→S)=0.4, P(B→B)=0.6, what is the stationary probability of state S? (Solve π = πP, π_S + π_B = 1)
Explain why high persistence (diagonal values near 1) affects average holding periods.
questions.answer_text: Higher self-transition probabilities lengthen expected time spent in a regime before switching.
